# scrollItemAtIndexToTop(_:)

**Instance Method**

Scrolls the combo box’s pop-up list vertically so that the item at the given index is as close to the top as possible.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor func scrollItemAtIndexToTop(_ index: Int)
```

## Parameters

- **index**: The index of the item to scroll to the top.

## Discussion

The pop-up list need not be displayed at the time this method is invoked.

## Manipulating the Displayed List

- **indexOfItem(withObjectValue:)**: Searches the combo box’s internal item list for the given object and returns the matching index number.
- **itemObjectValue(at:)**: Returns the object located at the specified location in the internal item list.
- **noteNumberOfItemsChanged()**: Informs the combo box that the number of items in its data source has changed.
- **reloadData()**: Marks the combo box as needing redisplay, so that it will reload the data for visible pop-up items and draw the new values.
- **scrollItemAtIndexToVisible(_:)**: Scrolls the combo box’s pop-up list vertically so that the item at the given index is visible.
